activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch II

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tierany Jean Mahr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tierany Jean Mahr appeared by video.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Tierany Jean Mahr.  Attorney Skiles appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney waives reading of information. Charges and max penalties were read. Court enters not guilty pleas on record.

Defendant Tierany Jean Mahr appeared by video.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Tierany Jean Mahr.  Attorney Skiles appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives rights for a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and will bind over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/Schedule scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Tierany Jean Mahr appeared by phone.  Attorney Gericke appears for Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow by video for Tierany Jean Mahr.  Attorney Long appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond. Modify bond no contact to include allow phone contact to facilitate child exchange. 3rd Party to orchestrate exchange. All other conditions remain the same.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
